norm1.subject: Deployers of an emotion recognition system or a biometric categorisation system
norm1.action: inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system, and process personal data in accordance with Regulations (EU) 2016/679 and (EU) 2018/1725 and Directive (EU) 2016/680
norm1.object: natural persons exposed to the system
norm1.text_snippet: Deployers of an emotion recognition system or a biometric categorisation system shall inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system, and shall process personal data in accordance with Regulations (EU) 2016/679 and (EU) 2018/1725 and Directive (EU) 2016/680, as applicable.

norm2.subject: Deployers of an emotion recognition system or a biometric categorisation system
norm2.action: inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system, and process personal data in accordance with Regulations (EU) 2016/679 and (EU) 2018/1725 and Directive (EU) 2016/680
norm2.object: natural persons exposed to the system
norm2.text_snippet: Deployers of an emotion recognition system or a biometric categorisation system shall inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system, and shall process personal data in accordance with Regulations (EU) 2016/679 and (EU) 2018/1725 and Directive (EU) 2016/680, as applicable.

conflicts.description: Condition inconsistency: 'inform the natural persons exposed thereto of the operation of the system, and process personal data in accordance with Regulations (EU) 2016/679 and (EU) 2018/1725 and Directive (EU) 2016/680' has different conditions in application vs pre_application

resolution.rationale: No clear canon applies. As a default, preferring pre_application. Human review recommended.

sources.text_snippet: Providers shall ensure that AI systems intended to interact directly with natural persons are designed and developed in such a way that the natural persons concerned are informed that they are interac
